FuncDef:
The source command configures a source IP address or source interface for a tunnel interface.
The undo source command deletes a source IP address or source interface for a tunnel interface. The source command configures a source IP address or source interface for a tunnel interface. The undo source command deletes a source IP address or source interface for a tunnel interface. By default, no source IP address or source interface is configured for a tunnel. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the source IP address for a tunnel interface.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the type of the source interface of a GRE tunnel.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

Specifies the source interface number for a tunnel.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

ExtraInfo: When configuring a tunnel, you must create a tunnel interface and run the source command to configure the source address on the tunnel interface. The IP address of the interface that sends packets should be specified as the source address on the tunnel interface.
